Title: AN ACT APPROPRIATING THE SUM OF FIVE HUNDRED AND TEN DOLLARS, IN MONEY OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR DEFRAYING EXPENSES INCURRED IN THE PUBLICATION OF VOLUME I OF "THE OPINIONS OF THE ATTORNEY-GENERAL OF THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS."
Data:
[ Act No. 1028, December 18, 1903 ]
AN ACT APPROPRIATING THE SUM OF FIVE HUNDRED AND TEN DOLLARS, IN MONEY OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR DEFRAYING EXPENSES INCURRED IN THE PUBLICATION OF VOLUME I OF "THE OPINIONS OF THE ATTORNEY-GENERAL OF THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS."
By authority of the United States, be it enacted by the Philippine Commission, that:
Section 1. The sum of five hundred and ten dollars, in money of the United States, is hereby appropriated, out of any funds in n the Insular Treasury not otherwise appropriated, to pay for services rendered in connection with the publication of Volume 1 of "The Opinions of the Attorney-General of the Philippine Islands," as follows: Charles A. Engelbracht, four hundred and fifty dollars; Gustavus A. Ohlinger, sixty dollars.
Section 2.1a—àphi1 The public good requiring the speedy enactment of this bill, the passage of the same is hereby expedited in accordance with section two of "An Act prescribing the order of procedure by the Commission in the enactment of laws," passed September twenty-sixth, nineteen hundred.
Section 3. This Act shall take effect on its passage.
Enacted, December 18, 1903.
